_documentation.format: Each race defines its requirements, modifiers, and abilities
_documentation.requirements: Minimum ability scores required to play this race
_documentation.modifiers: Ability score adjustments applied during character creation

races.name: Human
races.description: Humans are the most common race in most fantasy worlds. They are versatile and ambitious, often serving as the standard by which other races are measured. Humans have no special abilities, but also no restrictions on class choice.
races.detailed_description: Humans are the most adaptable and ambitious race. They have shorter lifespans than most other races, but they make up for it with their determination and versatility. Humans can be found in every profession and walk of life, from humble farmers to mighty kings. They are quick to learn and eager to explore new frontiers.

special_abilities.name: Versatility
special_abilities.description: Humans may be any character class with no restrictions

special_abilities.name: Ambition
special_abilities.description: Humans gain experience 10% faster than other races (optional rule)

races.name: Dwarf
races.description: Dwarves are a sturdy race, shorter and stockier than humans. They are renowned for their skill in smithing and craftsmanship, as well as their resistance to magic and poison. Dwarves have a natural affinity for underground environments.
races.detailed_description: Dwarves are known for their skill in warfare, their ability to withstand physical and magical punishment, their knowledge of the earth's secrets, their hard work, and their capacity for drinking ale. They are a proud and traditional people, with strong clan loyalties and long memories for both friendships and grudges.

special_abilities.name: Darkvision
special_abilities.description: Can see in complete darkness up to 60 feet, but only in black and white

special_abilities.name: Magic Resistance
special_abilities.description: +4 bonus to saving throws against magic wands, staves, rods, and spells

special_abilities.name: Poison Resistance
special_abilities.description: +4 bonus to saving throws against poison

special_abilities.name: Giant Fighting
special_abilities.description: +1 to attack rolls against giants, ogres, and similar large creatures

special_abilities.name: Defensive Training
special_abilities.description: Enemies suffer -4 penalty to attack rolls against dwarves due to their defensive training against larger foes

special_abilities.name: Stonework Detection
special_abilities.description: 1-2 on 1d6 chance to detect sloping passages, new construction, or unsafe walls when within 10 feet

restrictions: Cannot be Magic-Users due to their resistance to magic

races.name: Elf
races.description: Elves are tall, long-lived humanoids with pointed ears and graceful features. They have a natural affinity for magic and archery, and possess keen senses that allow them to detect hidden doors and passages.
races.detailed_description: Elves are a magical people of otherworldly grace, living in forests and other secluded places. They love nature and magic, art and artistry, music and poetry. Elves can live well over 700 years, giving them a broad perspective on events that might trouble the shorter-lived races more deeply.

special_abilities.name: Darkvision
special_abilities.description: Can see in complete darkness up to 60 feet, but only in black and white

special_abilities.name: Keen Senses
special_abilities.description: 1-2 on 1d6 chance to detect secret or concealed doors when within 10 feet, 1 on 1d6 when just passing by

special_abilities.name: Sleep Immunity
special_abilities.description: Immune to ghoul paralysis and sleep spells

special_abilities.name: Archery Expertise
special_abilities.description: +1 to attack rolls with bows and thrown weapons

special_abilities.name: Spell Resistance
special_abilities.description: +2 bonus to saving throws against charm and similar mental effects

restrictions: May only advance to 4th level as a Fighter
May only advance to 8th level as a Thief

races.name: Halfling
races.description: Halflings are small, cheerful folk who love comfort and the simple pleasures of life. They are naturally stealthy and have remarkable luck, making them excellent scouts and adventurers despite their peaceful nature.
races.detailed_description: Halflings are an affable and cheerful people. They cherish the bonds of family and friendship as well as the comforts of hearth and home, harboring few dreams of gold or glory. Even adventurous halflings usually venture into the world for reasons of community, friendship, wanderlust, or curiosity.

special_abilities.name: Small Size
special_abilities.description: +1 Armor Class bonus due to small size

special_abilities.name: Missile Attack Bonus
special_abilities.description: +1 to attack rolls with all missile weapons

special_abilities.name: Hiding Ability
special_abilities.description: Can hide in wilderness with 90% success rate, or 2-in-6 in dungeons

special_abilities.name: Brave
special_abilities.description: +4 bonus to saving throws against fear effects

special_abilities.name: Keen Hearing
special_abilities.description: 2-in-6 chance to hear noise (as a 1st level Thief)

restrictions: May only advance to 4th level as a Fighter
May only advance to 6th level as a Cleric
